intro: Hyperbaena eladioana, commonly known as the Eladio's hyperbaena, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
